page.title: 01Cornard.A resume of the area
page.content: Great Cornard is a former small village situated in the Stour Valley in Suffolk close to the town of Sudbury.It grew rapidly in the 1960's due to overspill population from London.The result is now a very large village of over 8000 people.It lies in a predominantly agricultural region specialising in cereal growing with pastoral farming near the watermeadows.Industry has been attracted and road improvements are being carried out.The area one of outstanding natural beauty is associated with the 2 painters Constable and Gainsborough with many attractive buildings and tourism is a major activity of the region.Sudbury is the main shopping centre but many travel to Colchester,Ipswich or Bury St.Edmunds for major shopping.The area contains many London commuters and has good road and rail links.
